subject: Re: [junit] Programmer Tests and the Database
msgSnippet: On 2/7/03 11:00 AM, Shellman, Joel  ... If you have database access spread throughout your code, different places will do
messageBody:
On 2/7/03 11:00 AM, "Shellman, Joel" <joel.shellman@...>
wrote:

>> That's probably true if the SQL never has to change. If the
>> schema changes, I find it more convenient to go to one known
>> place instead of having to search my entire app for possible changes.
>
> I find statements like this rather curious. Any decent (well, IMHO)
> IDE/editor/etc. should support global search and replace functionality.
> "Search my entire app for possible changes" in eclipse is all of: "Type
> ctrl-h, type in regex, hit enter", and boom, you have every point in your
> entire app that requires changing. In many cases, you put in the replacement
> value and your entire change is done in one simple step.
>

If you have database access spread throughout your code, different places
will do the accessing differently. One place might use a table to do a join,
another uses a table to create a view, and yet a third uses the table as a
target for a SELECT. Rearrange the schema and it's rarely clear what the
changes to the app are going to have to be, let alone writing a regex to
locate them.
